page.title: 13TOURISM
page.content: Two million tourists visit the Berwick area each year,most from Britain(about 50% of these from Lancs,Yorks and E. Midlands) with others from America, Europe and Australia in particular. Berwick's main attraction is as a quiet seaside resort with impressive historical architecture - particularly the Elizabethan walls - and close to areas of outstanding natural beauty and the Northumberland National Park. Efforts have been made to maintain this image and avoid commercialisation Over 25% of the visitors use static caravans as accommodation,particularly at the Berwick Holiday Centre at Low Greens,with its on-site entertainment and leisure facilities,and at E.Ord.
